Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bvanzett
Reviews.Content: Good location next to rome's (limited) metro system. The place is clean enough and had breakfast included. Rooms are ok but the shower is terrible if you want a hot show for more than 2min and also has next to no pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: holiday4usCambs
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and helpful reception staff. Room clean and comfortable and very warm. Very basic breakfast. Pastries, bread, packet toast, box cereals. Tea and coffee. Our room was next to the breakfast room so we were woken every morning by knocking which we discovered was the old coffee granules being emptied out of the coffee machine for each cup of coffee made, (good coffee) otherwise we slept well.. There was free Internet access, but it did not work in the rooms. We were 4 th floor, so we had to sit in reception for Internet access. Very good location close to many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeyturner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Petit offers very good value. its close to all amenities, easy and safe walk from the train station. the breakfasts were good, plenty to chose from. second helpings were no problem. reception staff were helpful as to where to go, how to get there.rooms were medium size, quiet and modestly appointed. comfortable beds, and the rooms and building were clean.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shtefy
Reviews.Content: I was on a small trip in Rome, with my 9 friends. We stayed at Le Petit Hotel. Our experience with the hotel was positive. I was very impressed with the location, close to metro and buses station. The hotel staff was very friendly and professional. The breakfast was very good and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. We really liked the hotel and would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “impressions hotel le petit”
Reviews.Author: mihaela r
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, excellent location, close to metro , services very good... the room was nice not so small how i read

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Hogg79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near tourist sites and the train station and has clean, but small rooms. However, our air conditioning never worked in our room and the hotel staff was indifferent. Also, the breakfast was poor as others have indicated.

Reviews.Title: “Little, very little and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: lidi
Reviews.Content: We went 3 nights in Rome two couples and we stayed at the Hotel Le Petit. Now, the price per night is very high, but in Rome center, all the hotels are very expensive.Is a small hotel distributed between the second and fourth floor of an elegant old building. The areas are well cared for and decorated, but everything very small. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is very small, has 16 seats, many people accumulate at 8.30 for breakfast. Breakfast is simple, a continental breakfast with very good expresso and capuccino, toasts, bread with jam and marmelade, some pastries and a few kelloggs. That's all, no ham, no salads, no sandwiches. Girls serving on breakfast room are very gentle and friendly. Rooms are little, so small that you hardly pass between the wall and your bedside, but well mantained and decorated. Bathroom are completely news but the shower is so narrow that yoy hardly go in and out. Anyway, having stayed other times in Rome, I would stay here again. For the situation, is only five minuts walking from Termini Station, Santa Maria Maggiore and close to Piazza Republica. Touristic Busses start their toute on the opposite side of Piazza Republica, so for a touristic trip is a very well situated hotel. Short walking to Quattro Fontane, Fontana dei Tritone and maybe 15 minutes walking from Fontana Di Trevi. Buses number 64 and 40 stops on the corner with Via Nazionale, and they take you to the Vatican, also close to Piazza Navona... Those are two useful bus lines, but are always crowded

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great staff, perfect location, pleasant accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: ComeDuermaViaja
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in this hotel. My husband and I have travelled a lot throughout Europe, and I was thrilled with Le Petit! Staff was fantastic, location was perfect. For this trip I was travelling with my 75-year-old mother, so convenience of transportation was important (and taxis in Rome are much more expensive than in, say, Madrid). The metro is a block away and on the red line, which hits more of the main tourists sites than the blue, and there are easy buses along Via Nazionale (right around the corner) to get to main sites. The staff was incredibly helpful in explaining the transportation and making excellent, non-touristy restaurant recommendations. My mother and I were both so happy with this hotel, that I feel the need to address some of the other reviewers' comments. Rooms were very clean, towels were changed every day (despite my request--in my halting Italian, so it's probably my fault--that neither towels nor sheets be changed every single day, as it seems a waste to me). Maybe it's because I live in the western U.S. where water is an issue, but I've stayed in very nice hotels from Chicago to Madrid that have signs about guests' option not to change towels and sheets every day as an environmental question, so I just don't think it's a big deal. Yes, of course, the rooms (and the shower) aren't very big; it's a European hotel in an older, gorgeous central part of an old European city, so I'm not sure what the other reviewers were expecting. Of course, the hotel was not cheap, but again it's Rome, so it's all relative. There's a lot of walking to do in Rome to start with, so a great location is important and worth a little extra to me. We loved this little hotel, and we will absolutely stay there again next time we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit - indeed but the staff was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Syrah35
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently (Sept 23-26, 2011) and was pleasantly surprised. I was already anticipating the worst after reading the reviews. This was my last leg of Europe travel (Paris, main Greece island, Rome) and I was already tired and a little jaded. I have to say this has been probably the 2nd favorite hotel I stayed at during my travels. That said a lot since I've stayed at various main hotel chains while in Greece because I traveled with a tour group. This review is based on a single occupancy room. Why do I like this hotel more than any other that I stayed at during this travel? Well, my overall experience was great! Staff was super awesome! Just my experience with the check in, the front desk person immediately gave me the lowdown on how to get around Rome, even recommended places to visit (which were ALL great, thank you!). My favorite was this older guy, super friendly. I was a little weirded out that it was only on the fourth floor and the office was located on the 2nd which shared with other businesses and residence. When I got to my room, I was pleasantly surprised! It was clean and had everything I needed. Mind you, it was super tiny and the bed isn't super soft (but for me, it was comfy and clean)! Maybe for most Americans, this would be about a 1/4-half the size of room you'd get in a typical hotel chain in the States and you'd have a single bed. However, it was clean, the water runs great (this should be a given, but I've stayed at some were the showers were either positioned weirdly, or water was not so good and there's something not working in the room), free wifi in the lobby (typical in most EU), and the air condition worked - which is a hit or miss in from my experience! :) They cleaned my room everyday, but I asked them not to do this since I don't need it cleaned everyday and just save water/time for their staff. The location was perfect, I practically walked everywhere, and very close to the bus, metro, train station and those open tour buses. If you're super particular and picky about hotels, this might be a 'bad hotel' for you. The breakfast was blah - but all I need is coffee, really, and they make it for you for free! There are some weird things like leaving your hotel key while you're out at the front desk - but I like this since I don't have to worry about losing it, plus it's good for my safety since I traveled alone. However, if you just want a comfortable room with great helpful staff and you're on a budget during your travel, I highly recommend this hotel. It's also on the 'noisier' side but if you've stayed at any major city hotels, this won't be a surprise. Overall, I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on a BUDGET and don't mind a small room... but have a great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel very very standard, nothing GOOD OR BAD”
Reviews.Author: Tamim00
Reviews.Content: The hotel: very standard nothing good or bad is noticeable. ( I had the room with the square balcony). Cleanliness: it is clean they change sheets and clean the bathroom daily. The balcony was dirty and they did not clean it. Location: Very good, close to metro and Termini Station, i liked the nazionale St. very vibrant at all times. Staff: One guy at the front disk is very friendly (for management > he told me he just bought a house) the old man is not. The breakfast lady is nice too. The breakfast: Do NOT expect any big breakfast, it is just a snack in the morning, Although they make you a fresh cappuccino and have fresh sweet croissant. But eat your snack in 10 min. and leave. Breakfast room is for Approx. 16 people only. Room and Bath: Clean, everything works, but a bit old. (U get what U pay for) Sleep:Our room was noisy. There was constant construction in the building making it hard to sleep past 6 30/ 7 am. No complains about the beds. But again U get what U pay for. Wi-fi: Free in the lobby. A/C: The room had a separate AC unit. And it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was pleasant enough. Clean, good location and breakfast was fair. The single rooms are small, but utilitarian and the washroom is modern. The staff however, was fabulous! All speak very good English and all were very accommodating and helpful. I unfortunately lost my passport and had to stay in Rome longer than planned. The staff allowed me to use their phone and computer to organize my necessary documents, even when I stayed at a different hotel the last few days!! (this one was full). I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: cdnands
Reviews.Content: This hotel is oddly situated in a office building on the 2nd and 4th floor, you must push a buzzer to get in to the building. We stayed here as it was close to the train station and we were en route to the airport early the next morning. The room was large clean and beds were a good size for quad occupancy. The noise level from the street below was excessive. The breakfast was very basic and the internet was only working in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “The name says all, "Petit". A small hotel, but I enjoyed the stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Moroco49x1
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Rome, Italy, and I needed a comfortable but not very expensive hotel and in the center of the city. So I found the Hotel Le Petit, which is a small but comfortable, clean and with good care. I got a room with air conditioning, a queen size bed, flat screen TV a small dresser with mirror and chair, a closet with a safe and two lamps on their bedside tables. It offers wireless Internet connection. The bathroom was also small, with shower, toilet, sink and bidet, all very clean. The staff is friendly and speaks English, Spanish and Italian. The room was cleaned daily, had enough towels and everything you need in the bathroom. At night there was always quiet and could rest properly. It offers a small breakfast consisting of juice, coffee, bread, butter, jam and cheese, as well as some fruits like apples, pears and bananas in a small room with tables for two or four people, attended by two girls very serviceable. It is very accessible either by bus or a subway station less than two blocks away. The high-speed trains station,that take you to other nearby cities or the airport is half a mile. The cost is suitable for what you get. I highly recommend for a pleasant stay in the Eternal City, Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel - Big service”
Reviews.Author: rnfyles
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Le Petit. Rooms are small and showers are very small.. However service and hotel staff were great. They spoke very good English and helped us navigate Roma with ease. Le Petit is walking distance from the train station. Around the corner from Metro and 200 feet from many bus lines. Rooms are small but enough room to put away your luggage and each room had a writting desk & AC. But the staff was the best. Always helpful and friendly and that is not always the case when traveling. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BenteJ1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, because: it was close to Metro, close to Termini. Close to Tram. It was situated in a "normal" area, not very touristy, like Piazza Navona. The staff was friendly. The breakfast ok, its a hotel... but nice cakes, good coffee. The room quiet and clean, and cozy... with a little balcony.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better!”
Reviews.Author: TA14
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reviewing before I selected a hotel. I read reviews, searched locations, etc. I picked this one for it's location and that is all it has. It is in a terrific spot, close to everything. There are little stores to purchase drinks/snacks, restaurants, shops just steps away. Also, close to central transportation. The problems. We had a balcony. No soundproofing at all. The room was gloomy, the bed was HARD, bedspread was dirty, the noise was terrible. Sirens, horns, etc. You may as well bring your bed to the sidewalk. The shower was small but the problem was the wand shower head. There are too many other hotels even in the direct vicinity of this hotel to stay here. Spend more if you have to. It's ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mum_Chamber
Reviews.Content: First, the good parts: The location is very central, people at the reception and the cleaning lady were both friendly. Not that they solved my problems, they were just friendly. Also, the central location combined with poor sound isolation means lots of annoying sounds in the middle of the night. Bring your earplugs with you!! And yes, this is still the good part! The negative sides of my experience evolve around the hygiene and service factors, which I believe are central to any hotel. Throughout my one week stay, the room was dusty and alarmed my allergies to a new level. The irritation continued even after I got rid of the blankets and the bed cover, which were really dusty. When I told the management that I wanted to cancel due to this general lack of hygiene, I was rejected with the excuse that a three day notice was necessary. I would expect them to try to solve this inconvenience, instead of making it a bigger issue for me. Moreover, the rail system for the showerhead wasn't stable and the showerhead (almost) fell on my head. And that thing is heavy!! When I asked the management to replace it, they first said I didn't have to use the rail system and could hold the showerhead (thanks for the suggestion). When I insisted, they said they will replace it, which never happened, instead they taped it. I don't call this good service. And how much does that rail system cost anyway? 10-15 euros? Come on.. Final verdict, choose this hotel only if you're looking for a top spot and don't care about anything else.

Reviews.Title: “hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MONKEYNJ
Reviews.Content: personal was extrem. helpfull. i book my trip through hotwire--big mistake--they book hotel outside of rome, but provide me with rome adress. when i arrived at hotel --was no room reserved. hotel staff was exelent .

Reviews.Title: “Best service, lovely staff - nice room!”
Reviews.Author: superhero077
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this hotel at the rate of 70 euro. A very nice hotel, with nice rooms and extremely friendly staff. I highly recommend this. A bit small rooms, but lovely baths.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: zulu5
Reviews.Content: Our room had a beautiful balcony that faced the via Torino. During the nights it rained, we would open the huge wooden shutters and soak in our gorgeous view of a bustling Roman street. The restaurant half a block down is a fabulous multi-course choice, and shopping on the via Torino and in the surrounding area is awesome -- everything from designer shops to farmer's markets all within two blocks. The room was a good size. We had two twin beds for our sons and the parents got the pullout couch, which was the only thing I can think to complain about. Everything else -- the breakfast, the staff, the bathroom, the neighborhood, proximity to a Metro stop -- was fantastic. It was quiet and comfortable. I would stay here again. The Termini station is only one stop away so sometimes we would just walk to Termini instead of taking the nearer metro stop. We loved Rome and this quaint, charming hotel was a big part of our pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal For Short Break”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowIan1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed there along with 11 year old son. Strange at first with reception on 2nd floor of building and rooms on the 4th. Great location for arrival in Rome. Took less then 10 minutes to walk and easy to find, just had to walk across the bus station outside the Termini Railway Station , turn left for a bit and then right when we came to the Via Torino. It's quite near the top of the street coming from that direction Arriving after 9pm and not wanting to stray to far with youngster, receptionist recommended a really great traditional Trattoria a couple of streets away. Small Tabbacari/bar next door to the hotel for a nightcap as well. Rooms have enough space to pass comfotably around the beds, but not much more, but you don't intend spending any time in your room apart from sleeping, or a short rest before going back out for the evening. Only English language channel i could fing on the telly was CNN. Beds were comfortable , and turned down for you, and the street outside was quiet at night and not that bad in the morning. Breakfast was fairly basic croissants and tea/coffee/hot chocolate, but pleasant enough and served quickly in the breakfast room on the 4th floor. Following two days, for sightseeing, we were just round the corner from the Republica Metro Station and found it easy getting about to the Coloseum first day and Vatican on the second day. Although we had to check out on the second day, reception were able to look after our bags and we returned for them before heading for the airport bus. Would have absolutely no problems with going back there next time I go to Rome. Checking out they were

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MicroBTS
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in a triple room. As we arrived early in the morning the room was not ready yet but we could leave our luggage at the check-in desk. The room was large enough for us, also with some space for our luggage in the small hallway. Room was clean and there was an adjustable air conditioning so we could set the teperature we wanted. The equipement was new and modern. Breakfast was good. Large variety of jams, rolls, ham ... coffee, tea etc. What I have to point out about this hotel, was the staff. They were very helpful, spoke perfect English, gave us a illustrated map of Rome, advised us how to get back to hotel using the public transport ... Maybe the only problem was a rather small shower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: cruisincindy55
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and I wanted to stay in the city center. The location was perfect, very close to Termini and easy to get anywhere we wanted. The Republicca Metro stop is a very short walk, closer than Termini. Giovani, as all the staff, was always smiling and helpful. We booked this hotel based on reviews from travel websites and since I was unsure if it would be my only trip to Europe, I wanted to get the terrace room. We were given 403, the terrace room on the 4th floor. The room has a sofa sleeper in it also, so I think it could sleep a 3rd person. There was plenty of room for us, a fairly large cabinet to store the suitcases we weren't needing for our short stay, 2 nights, before our cruise, and plenty of towels and hot water in the bathroom. The shower had more than enough room to move and rinse. I'm not a skiny person, either. Breakfast included not only the breads and juice, but meats and cheeses. I'm glad we decided to stay at this wonderful hotel and if I ever get the chance to return to Rome, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SP30
Reviews.Content: Great Location walking distance from Termini. Staff were very friendly. Room was small and especially the shower, it was tiny. Fuse blew and we had no lighting throughout the night but was repaired the next day. Breakfast was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ateva
Reviews.Content: Although close to Temini station, the location on Via Torino close to Via Nazionale is good. Room was on the small side but clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Reception located on the second floor was rather inconvenient as you had to drop off and pick up keys to room. Our room was on the fourth floor. Breakfast was not much with little choice unless your idea of breakfast is a great big fat iced donut.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courteous staff, Comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: murrayrubin
Reviews.Content: This lovely B&B was recommended to us by a local resident and professional driver named Nicola. (Nick). After arriving in Rome we checked into another apartment we had rented. Oh boy what a shock. Thank goodness we found the Hotel Petit. The staff there are so nice and accomodating. Rooms are clean, the breakfast is just great. We will be back. What a great little secret. Don't tell too many people our secret. We will have difficulty getting reservations. :-) Ciao Vito, Murray Rubin Blackwood NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Break”
Reviews.Author: RomeCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great little find. I was a bit worried at first as it had alot of bad reviews but I have to say it was a great find. It was rite on the via nationale which has plenty of shops and is walking distance to all the main sights and also to termini station which is a 5-10min walk.. The breakfast in the morning is very nice to get and the people on reception are very helpful. Its perfect as you dont spend anytime in the hotel as you do so much sightseeing. So if your looking for a hotel just to sleep at night and not worry about the luxurys other hotels can provide then this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Small and nice. Glad we chose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Essellanden
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, less than 100 yards from metro Repubblica and bus stops 40/64 on Via Nazionale. Nice, upscale neighborhood, not shabby or noisy like the streets near Termini. Hotel is on 2nd and 4th floor of the building. Rooms are a bit small, but adequate for a short stay. Everything was clean and in good working order. The staff were very nice and helpful. Good (expanded) continental breakfast, espresso or cappuccino included. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to do it all again!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustSouthWest
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from city break in the fantastic city of Rome staying at Le Petit-I took responsibility for booking hotel for 4 of us so was let's say a little concerned to read the recently posted review for early Jan this year-couldn't disagree more-we found everything just great-yes little noisy in the morning but it's a busy hotel in a busy city! Great location, breakfast was good, staff absolutely brilliant so helpful-extremely clean-towels changed every day-there were 4 of us in our party & we can't wait to make a return visit-would definately recommend Le Petit for your stay in Rome-we all wish we were still there!-try the little bar next door Vino Rosso excellent at just a few euro per glass-not a wine glass a large tumber! Happy Holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: JonBhoy
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel rooms are small but most of the time you are 'out and about' exploring the sites. If you are looking for a hotel with all the frills then give this one a miss, however if you are looking for a hotel that is comfortable, very clean and central then I would recommend this one. The Hotel is in a good location close to all the main sites you would wish to see. It can get noisy in the morning but you have to balance this against its central location. Staff were helpful and provided information when asked. Overall I would say this hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Giovanni!!!”
Reviews.Author: ourcruise06
Reviews.Content: Booked through our travel agent, so received the smaller room. Very tight quarters, but very nice, kept clean. We weren't in the room much anyway. Breakfast was nice. Great location!! Our first trip abroad, we were worried about location to major attractions, but we could walk to anywhere at most in 20 minutes. Giovanni was a Godsend. Airtraffic controllers were on strike the day we were to fly out. Called Giovanni who didn't have any rooms, but told us to come back and he would help us out. He let us use the Wi-fi to e-mail work and family of the delay, then called around and found us another room. What a lifesaver! We would stay there again quite happily, but book on our own and get the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Made a mistake picking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaGamaReborn
Reviews.Content: I would ordinarily have rated this hotel a 1 but for the reasonably central location. I stayed here with family taking up 2 doubles (408 & 409) and a single room (404), from 30-Dec-07 to 2-Jan-08. Right, a quick run through the pros which are not too many anyway: 1) Reasonably central location: Close to the Colosseum and Roman Forum (take a left from the hotel down Via Nazionale and then take a left down Via De Serpenti) 2) Staff helpful with directions and things to see and ways to get there 3) Special commendation for Gianni at the front desk in the mornings, who fully understood our problems and tried to help us to the fullest. Please note that the person we had the most problems with is not named below in the Reception Staff so as to avoid any personal affront. 4) Plenty of hot water in the shower Cons: I recommend you sit down with a cup of coffee because this is going to be long. 1) Tiny rooms (helpful suggestion from one of the reception staff at the front desk who said "You should have figured it out from the name Le Petit"). No room in the room to walk around freely - in fact, the room should be called and advertised as a "Hole" and not a " Room". 2) Place for only one piece of luggage on the chair/support 3) Tiny shower cubicles - I could not stretch out both my elbows at the same time. Scrubbing my back was out of the question. 4) Breakfast was miniscule and pre-packaged (mostly) compared to the delicious spreads we enjoyed in hotels at Venice and Florence which we visited before Rome. 5) My sister-in-law's family was charged 10 EUR/night extra for my niece's breakfast and use of towels!!!! No extra bed was provided and she had to squeeze into the usual double bed. 6) The shower in room 409 was not draining the first day 7) There was mold/fungus in the shower of room 408 Separate section: 8) Reception staff (this person is neither Gianni nor Vito): This gentleman is priceless. We wanted to check out on the second day due to all the problems above and since desperation had led me to personally check the Best Western Mondial just next door which had better and larger rooms, good breakfast and was charging LESS!!! Hotel Le Petit's rates were more than 15% higher than the Mondial's. Due to the Le Petit's minimum stay policy of 3 days, we could not go scot free (i.e. without paying a penalty) which is perfectly reasonable but they were still asking for a ridiculously high compromise. I tried to reason with the gentleman at the desk who firstly did not understand most of what we were saying. I was reducing to showing exactly how I was having a shower with my arms bent in. I then wrote out a detailed letter to the owner explaining why we wanted to check out and how much we were prepared to pay as a penalty since the receptionist above said "I cannot disturb the owner with your problems"!!!! I guess that says enough about his particular attitude to any problems the guests may have. As the hotel was not prepared to come down to the compromise price which we were suggesting, I conveyed to the receptionist that the hotel was basically forcing dissatisfied guests to stay on and there were ways in which we could spread this. One of the main reasons I'm writing this review is because of the man's response produced below (fairly verbatim): "I don't think anything you say or do will hurt the owner or the hotel". I have photos of the place which I haven't yet uploaded. I can attach it to this review later or post a separate review on this place to prove the physical discomfort at this place. If you still want to stay at this hotel, you must be one adventurous person :-)

Reviews.Title: “Termini section of Rome is underrated”
Reviews.Author: kmkessler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a bit of an odd layout. It's in a building that it shares with some offices, and the reception desk, along with a few rooms are on the 2nd floor, while most of the rooms and the breakfast area are on the 4th floor. Since you have to give the reception desk your key whenever you leave the hotel, it is a bit of a pain to have to stop at the second floor every time you go out, but that a pretty minor nit-pick. The rooms were small, but that is to be expected in a more reasonable priced hotel in any large city. We stayed at the hotel for the first 3 nights of our Italy vacation, and the last night before we flew out. The staff was very friendly; when we checked out on the last day before we had to head back to the airport, the receptionist was so excited to tell us about someone putting red dye in the Trevi Fountain that he followed us the whole way to the elevator, chatting away. The hotel does not have any internet access, but, given it's odd location, I was able to stand by the window in my room, and get on some open WiFi networks, and send some emails. I've often read that the Termini section of town is not one of the best locations to stay at, but I don't agree. I agree there isn't a whole lot to do right in the neighborhood and I didn't find any good restaurants in the area (all the restaurants in Rome were over-priced and not very good, compared to everywhere else I went in Italy). But it isn't at all seedy or dangerous; it's a very hustle and bustle type area. What I liked best about it, though, was the fact that you have easy access to all types of transportation to the other parts of the city and the rest of the country (the train, metro, buses). When you are in another part of the city, and want to get back to your hotel, it is very easy to find a bus that heads back to that area, because most buses start and stop at Termini (the Metro red and blue lines end there too). Trying to figure out what bus to take and what stop to get off to get to other parts of Rome can be a bit more of a challenge. Overall, I recommend this hotel to someone who wants to use it as a place to sleep and shower, and who doesn't expect a hotel to do a whole lot more for them.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: michaelmelton1
Reviews.Content: Like many hotels we experienced in Italy, the room is small, the bed is hard, and the shower is tiny...but the location is great. and the price is amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem...”
Reviews.Author: Lainey-b01
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with a great location. We stayed here for four nights between end of August and start of September. We initially found it hard to find a hotel reasonably priced and not compromising too much on room quality and location but chose Le Petit Hotel on recommendations on Trip Advisor. The Hotel reception staff were very welcoming, spoke excellent English and freely gave tourist advice on our check in. In comparison to photos on Trip Advisor it seems that the rooms on the hotels second floor at least have been recently renovated. Air conditioning worked a dream, comfortable bed, Italian digital TV (SKY) with option to listen in English on a selection of channels. The bathroom had a good strong hair dryer, good space around the sink and shower. The room was serviced daily. The hotel is 10 minute walk from Rome main train station, 2 minute walk from Metro and bus stop across the road on Via Nationazle. Take the 64 or 40 to go to Vatican. 15-20 minute walk to Spanish Steps, 25 minute walk to Piazza Venezia and a 25-30 minute walk to the Coloseum and Roman Form. Lovely restaurant around the corner of the hotel and for fellow Irish there are 3 "Irish" bars in close proximity to the hotel, the nearest is two minutes down Via Nationazle serving food and the obligatory Guinness, not cheap be expected to pay a premium for the familiar Irish, American and German beer brands, roughly € 5 - €5.50 for a pint! My advice is to stick to the local stuff but generally only find this in local restaurants. My only criticism of the hotel is the Breakfast, very small selection. We got Croissant, local bread with cheese, selection of Kellogg’s cereal and some Juice. No cheese or meat selection like all other Continental breakfasts. We skipped breakfast on 3 out of our 4 night stay (breakfast ends at 9.30), my advice would be to call into DeSpar on way down Via National if heading that direction. You can pick up the necessary bottle of water for 50 cent and a wide range of fruit and rolls. Avoid if possible the water and fruit stalls on the street, €2.50 for a bottle of water - extortion! Le Petit Hotel defiantly exceeded our expectations. We have already passed our impressions onto friends of ours who previously had a bad experience in their choice of Rome accommodation; they too were very impressed with Le Petit Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Amytomsam
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from the Hotel Le Petit in Rome where we have enjoyed a 3 night break with the kids. Our children are 4, 6 and 10. We stayed in 2 rooms (407 and 408) a triple and a double. I actually chose this hotel by reading other users' feedback on trip advisor and they have been very accurate. Good stuff about this hotel: The guy on reception was VERY helpful when we arrived and showed us the best buses to get, Metro etc and his English was excellent. The accommodation (beds and bathrooms) were clean and tidy which is what is really important. Both rooms were serviced daily and there were plenty of clean towels and hot water for showers. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the nearest Metro and bus stops which made getting around VERY easy and cheap. You can buy tickets from the news stall just on the Piazza Del Republicca for 4 Euro per 'adult' (Child over10) and roam the public transport system with these tickets all day! WATCH OUT for pick pockets on crowded buses though...we lost our wallet/cards/money on a bus on the way back from Piazza Barberini on the Saturday night and they (buses!) are notorious for this problem we found out later! The hotel is good value for money overall (in the context of Roman hotels!) Could do better stuff with this hotel...... Could have done with tea/coffee making facilities or a bar available within the hotel. (there is a mini bar in the room but we didn't use it at all)....There is a snack shop beside the hotel but they aren't equipped for drinks on the go so had to pour my cappuccino into a previously emptied orange juice bottle so I could take it back to my room because the kids were asleep! (With husband...I didn't leave them alone!!!) If you are at the hotel, there is no seating/communal area so it is your room or bust.....we found that a bit challenging with 3 children and small spaces so had to go out to keep them occupied. Normally, there would be a bar we could gat a coffee and a Coke for the kids and we could relax whilst they chatted/played with Gameboys etc without having to be in our rooms. It is rather noisy all the time as there is a busy one way street outside the hotel. The A/C in room 407 wasn't that effective and we couldn't get it cool enough, whereas the A/C in room 408 was too effective but we couldn't shut it down! There are slatted sliding shutters on the French doors to room 407 but we couldn't move them so the room was quite dark, as was room 408. Breakfast was a bit limited with no meats/fruit and the dining room is VERY small...guests were coming in and taking plates of food back to their rooms because it was busy at around 08.30. Still, it was completely suitable to fill you up (I'm just being picky!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Paulowl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very modern and although the rooms may not be the biggest are quite adequet considering they are only used for sleep. The standard of the room more than made up for this. The staff here are very cheerful and helpful. We were given a map on arrival and given bus numbers etc for attractions around Rome. It is ideally situated within walking distance (max 30 mins) from the main attractions Vatican, Colleseum etc. The restaurant down via Nationazle on right hand side with outdoor seating, forgotten name, is very good food and value. Also Mr Chow Chinese restaurant is good. For more good restuarants visit the Spanish Steps at night there is a good selection around here. We would also recommend going to the Botanical Gardens as these are very nice and ideal to get some peace away from the hustle and bustle of the busy Rome roads and streets. All in all I would definately stay at this hotel if I visit Rome in the future. Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jus perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathaliasp
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location and previous tripadvisor reviews, which, by the way, were very helpful. The hotel is small and friendly, the location is perfect for sightseeing. We chose the family room (for 4 adults) and we couldn’t have had better choice! The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable; it seemed to be refurbished lately. The bathroom (including the shower) was also very nice with a plentiful supply of soft white towels. Above everything, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with maps, showing us around, where to go and what was the best way to get there. Breakfast was just perfect. The best cappuccino I’ve ever had! I look forward to returning to this hotel next year and I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Top value!”
Reviews.Author: StuartHammill
Reviews.Content: Hotel L/P is located but a short walk from Termini and thus easy to find with a good map. Situated on a busy street, you will experience traffic noise in your rooms. But, so what? You're there for the sights and the food! And the hotel is near to both.The faint hearted may find the nearby underground station comforting, the more adventurous can set off on foot. The hotel itself is clean and the staff very friendly - happy to give us breakfast when we overslept a couple of times! Breakfast itself is plentiful - cereals, spreads, tea/coffee and so on.Fussy Brits can even take their own tea bags! Our room was small, but romantic enough for two - the en-suite perfectly good and cleaned every day with change of towels.Each day the bed was made too, which was neither needed nor anticipated. Small fridge with some drinks, but remove them and chill your bottled water which you will need in the heat of the summer.If you're going to enjoy Rome and be out as much as possible, then this is the right place to rest your tired body at the end of each day esp after a good meal and some vino from the good restaurants nearby. Some might find the beds hard. Firm more like, but not a real problem. Enjoy and say hello from us!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in June”
Reviews.Author: caterinabelle
Reviews.Content: hotel was handily located near Termini, however rooms were not much to write home about, beds were rock hard and breakfast was basic at best. staff on reception were helpful and friendly which somewhat made up for it lacking in other areas. In terms of location and distance from hotel to the main attractions in Rome - buses go from across the road on Nazionale to most attractions, however the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum and the Forum are a good 20 - 30 minute walk away so not as central as I was led to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Missing Rome/ Georgie from San Mateo, CA”
Reviews.Author: missingrome69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 27 until June 2, 2007. It's a pretty decent hotel, very clean. A little bit small specially the bathroom but hey, it's Europe. Staff are very nice and helpful and location wise, it's perfect . Walking distance to all the major attractions (better have good walking shoes though). Metro is just a couple minutes away from the hotel. There's also a couple of great restaurants that's close by. A block from the hotel is a restaurant called Target, food is awesome. A little bit pricey but really good. The hotel also serves continental breakfast which is actually pretty good (we had breakfast there every morning). You get a lot of choices (unlike other places). There are choices of danish, toast, cereals, salami, assorted cheeses, coffee and juice. If you ever decide to go to Rome, I recommend Hotel Le Petit. It's a great place to stay and not to mention, affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MRMRSSUITCASE
Reviews.Content: Very central for places of interest. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and cheerfully served. Our rooms were clean and Domestic staff were pleasant and helpfull although rooms were not huge they were adequate. No tea making facilities in room. Would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: suealm
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Rome & enjoyed our stay at this hotel so we booked again direct. The staff were friendly, polite and very helpful, providing maps & advice. The hotel was excellently situated, a short walk from the Termini Station, next to the Repubblica Metro station & main bus stops. Will definately stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: KentScotabroad
Reviews.Content: My stay at the petit hotel was excelent. The staff were always friendly, helpful and smart. The room was small but clean and perfectly adequqate for a city break with comfortable beds and air conditioning. Right from the time of arrival the staff helped with routes, maps and places to see. They all spoke good english and gave good advice about how to get the most from our short break. If I returm to Rome, I would definately consider booking this accomodation again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonmcc
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short visit here and found it to be a fantastic little hotel. The entrance is a little unusual (press the buzzer and walk up two flights of stairs to the reception) but after that it's great. The rooms are very clean and tidy, the position is superb (less than 1 mile from the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Roman Forum etc), there is a metro very nearby if you don't fancy walking, but I would advise walking in such a stunning city. Some rooms are small, but as mentioned earlier, are very clean, tidy and well equipped. Ours had a nice balcony area as well. The hotel staff are the best I have ever come across. Gianni on the reception was superbly helpful to us and gave us some excellent advice. We were a group of ten staying and all of us thought it was a great hotel to stay in and are planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great Value Service”
Reviews.Author: kev1516
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the many reviews on this site. They give a great description of what to expect. The room I had was a single, and it was perfect for what I needed. Everything was modern, clean, and worked as it should. The rooms to the front can be a little noisy but only as to be expected in the centre of Rome, on a narrow street. Location is fantastic from the termni, and it feels perfectly safe as it is just down from the main street. The service is great, the staff are more than helpful, and ensure a pleasant stay. I will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's perfect”
Reviews.Author: qñ
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel in a good location. You can arrive to the Fontana de Trevi, piazza Venezia and the roman areas walking about 10-15 minutes. Near to the hotel you can found shops, 24 h chemist, restaurants and fast food restaurants. The room is little but it has the services that you can need: TV, hairdryer, a little fridge, electric heating... But without a doubt, the most value for this hotel: the workers. When we arrive to the Fiumicino airport, Iberia had lost our baggage, we put a reclamation and we didn't worry about it, because the personal of the reception often phoned the airport for information and they called us to the movile phone with the latest news about the situacion until the suitcase arrived. I'll always be greateful to their The breakfast was ok. I recomend a capuccino!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanz
Reviews.Content: After reading a range of reviews about Le Petit, I decided to stay there for 7 nights during November. I am a female, single traveller from Australia, aged 51. I stayed in a single room for two nights and a double room for five nights. The shower in the single room was tiny (and only slightly larger in the double room) but what should one expect from a hotel named Le Petit in Europe, where most rooms in budget accommodation are very small. Yes, the lobby is on the 2nd floor and the rooms up on the 4th, but this is not a problem. There is a small elevator big enough for one person and your luggage and there is a security door at the front of the building, so you just buzz to get in at any time. Other tenants in the building are mostly professionals -- doctors etc -- so there is no reason for alarm about sharing the building. Wi-fi access is avaiilable on the 2nd floor lobby if you plan to take your own notebook. There are two internet cafes around the corner (make sure you take some ID with you: the government requires that internet operators request it from you). The hotel is tastefully decorated in a modern Roman style (beautifully sponged walls -- each room in a different colour) with plain bedspreads, and a little bar fridge in your room is stocked with drinks and snacks at fairly reasonable prices. The rooms are cleaned daily and the beds made with fresh sheets. Fresh towels are also supplied daily and there is a hair dryer in the bathroom. Because the building is solid stone, it doesn't require much heating or cooling and I found the temperature in the room to be perfect most of the time (like the weather in Rome -- a beautiful 20 degrees C and sunny during the week I was there). You can even open and close the windows to regulate the music of the traffic below, as required. The location of the hotel is quite perfect, near the Termini Stazione, but also within walking distance from all the major landmarks (the Colosseum etc) and cultural attractions (the Opera House is around the corner). There are plenty of shops and restaurants and a few trattoria nearby, as well as two supermarkets around the corner. Most of the hotel staff speak English to a medium level (and one is learning French!) so they can direct you to all attractions and major tour operators with the aid of a simple map which they will supply. I can see why some people might find the walk from the station with luggage a little strenuous. Roman streets are small and very busy by world standards, so rather than dragging your luggage through and around obstacles, I would suggest the easiest way to get from the airport would be to catch a shuttle bus. You can pick one up from the airport by paying at the info desk upon arrival, or book in advance as I did over the internet(using viator.com) also paying in your own national currency. What more can you want from a budget hotel in Rome, apart from quite a generous continental breakfast, which includes as as many freshly made cups of coffee (including capuccino) or tea, as required? This is prepared by warm, friendly staff (all of whom who are happy to have a chat with you ,if you feel like it, just to improve their English). No old dripolators or percolators overbrewing in this place! In true Italian style, you get the real thing. There is a Nescafe instant sachet to be found anywhere in this place. On the mornings that I needed to leave before breakfast was scheduled to be served, they insisted I take a croissant or two with me to eat on the run. I found this quite helpful, given I had to leave the hotel at 7am for my all day trip to Pompeii, where the first food stop from the bus was at 10am). Overall, I found this to be a lovely little hotel that was good value for money in an otherwise rather expensive city (especially if you're exchanging Australian dollars for spending there!). I would not hesitate to stay at Le Petit again. My only advice is to be aware that the beds are very hard (well, in the past Romans have been known to sleep on concrete) and the pillows are very flimsy(but they will give you extra pillows when you ask for them). These are honest, hard-working proprietors and staff. Give them a fair go and you'll reap much in return. They are very good humoured and will teach you some key Italian words and phrases, while always trying their best to please you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: californiainuk
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews and booked via airmiles so got a deal for £50. Had I paid £75 or more I'd be giving this hotel a lower rating. Firstly, I should mention that the staff were friendly and helpful, and this review is nothing against them. On that note...it was clear that the 2nd floor had gone through a remodel, though the 4th floor and our room (411) clearly hadn't!! I don't mind a small room, but there is no excuse for a disgusting moldy shower and wallpaper that was peeling off the wall full of mold. The beds were very hard and the pillows were flat. The closet smelled very odd and we were reluctant to put our clothes in it. Twice we had to ask for a bathmat to step out of the shower on as when our room was cleaned it wasn't replaced. Unless you are fortunate enough to get one of the coveted corner rooms which apparently book 2 months in advance and need to be booked through the hotel directly, I would not recommend this hotel based on our experience.The location was very convenient, though would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “See you again next year”
Reviews.Author: senic
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location and previous tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is small and friendly and the location is perfect for sightseeing. Our 4th floor room was very quiet, comfortable, nicely furnished with fridge/mini bar, flat screen TV and air con. Double glazed patio doors opened on to a small balcony overlooking a busy street. The bathroom was modern and spotless with a plentiful supply of soft white towels. The shower, although small was powerful providing lots of hot water. Breakfast whilst not exactly your "English fryup" was quite adequate with bread, juice, croissants, cheese, selection of cereal, tea or coffee. Staff were helpful and always willing to provide extra coffee etc. Reception staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. They provided maps and advice. We look forward to returning to this hotel next year. Colin and Delphine from Scotland, October 16th 2006

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Location. Derby, UK travellers.”
Reviews.Author: Fiskerton
Reviews.Content: Helped by the other reviews on this site, we booked the hotel, and were not disappointed. Terrific location just off the Via Repubblica, with most key sites in the centre of Rome within half an hour"s walking distance, and even the Vatican 35 minutes quick walk away!! The staff were very friendly with lots of maps and advice on places to eat out at(with a good knowledge of the prices) and bars. We are not big breakfast eaters, so the continental fare of croissants and brilliant coffee was fine, but after a few days it did feel a bit repetitive, but that is a minor gripe. The room was small...we were not lucky in getting a larger one, and there seemed to be quite a few that appeared to be bigger(when we saw the cleaners in action!)...but it was clean, and more than compensated by an excellent bathroom and a terrific shower. There was plenty of wardrobe space in the bedroom and even though I"m not a great sleeper, the traffic noise did not bother me as much as I would have expected it to do. Also a nice bonus was an LCD tv with a mixture of Italian and satellite channels on it. Surprisingly there was a fully stocked mini-bar BUT no coffee or tea making facilities which would have been nice. Also once night falls, the lights in the room make reading difficult. Again a couple of small negatives, but hardly the end of the world! If you want a hotel with full facilities with bars, lounges, etc, then this is not the place for you. If you want some safe and clean comfort that doesn"t break your pocket, then go for Le Petit. When we go to Rome again, we will certainly try to go there again. Thanks to all the previous reviewers for a good pick!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JackPY
Reviews.Content: I'm actually a little hesitant in sharing this gem, as I'm sure its popularity will skyrise. My wife and I stayed on 4th floor corner room with a large balcony. Although we only stayed 1 night, it was head and shoulders beyond other similarly priced hotels we've stayed in Italy. I'm not sure about the other rooms, but you can't go wrong with 403 where we stayed. The balcony was almost as large as the room itself. Positives: Location, modern facilities, clean Negatives: If I have to pick a negative, I guess it may be the breakfast which is very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified B&B”
Reviews.Author: KenKell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Rome which we enjoyed immensely except for the hotel. While this hotel is in a good location and staff are friendly the room we had was dark, smelled of smoke, the shower head was broken, and worst of all the bed was so hard we might as well have slept on a park bench. Not how you want to spend a night after spending all day walking. We were very disappointed as I would not consider the rate cheap and would have expected more. Breakfast was only adequate in a small pokey room and the lobby is also very small. There are many more hotels in the same area which looked much nicer and comfortable. Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful balcony!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianIslanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit for 5 nights. We booked directly with the hotel by phone and were able to get a slight discount for doing so. I am not sure if we would have been happy there had we not had one of the two rooms with big doors leading to a wonderful outdoor patio. Since we were on the fourth floor, we were very close to the breakfast room and were able to go and get a tray made up for us and enjoy it on the patio. The lift was not working and, although not a problem for us, it may have been a negative for some staying on the fourth floor. I understand the hotel only has rooms on the second and fourth floor. The location is very good as it is close to the train (Termini) station and we used that twice. It is also very close to the Metro and a reasonable area for walking around. We walked to every major tourist site except for the Vatican. The hotel is very, very noisy due to its location to a main road. Honking horns were an all night feature as well as the sounds of motorcycles and buses. I had read this on TripAdvisor and went prepared with ear plugs. We chose to not use the a/c (it itself was noisy!) and had the patio doors open until it cooled off. Staff were friendly and I would stay again if we were able to get a room with a balcony. There were several little shops on either side of the hotel that sold sandwiches, wine, water etc. Also several good restaurants. The opera house is only a half block away.

Reviews.Title: “slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Molly73
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a wedding. The hotel was in a good location, not far from a Metro station and quite central. The reception up a couple of floors and is modern. The reception staff were very helpful. however the room we were assigned was very small. The en-suite was also small, but the shower was very good! The electrics were not too good. After using my hair dryer the lights later went off and did not come back on until the next day. I think this is a general problem with the electrics in hotels in Italy and they don't encourage you to use electrical products, hence there was only one iron in the hotel. The breakfast was poor enough also, and there wasn't anything that either of us would eat. The staff were very friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loction”
Reviews.Author: Mattiboy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2006. The hotel was in a fantastic position; close to the main railway station (5 minutes walk) and central to all the main Roman attractions. It was two minutes walk from the metro which takes you all over the city. The hotel was room was very clean and tidy (and we do like our posh hotels!) although there were some negative points. 1)The hotel is on floors 2,3 and 4 of the building. Unfortunately levels G and 1 are yet to be finished so the 'lobby' as such was more like a building site. Do not let this put you off though. The location is just great! 2) the "double bed" we were given was two single beds pushed together; not really what you expect for the money and especially in one of the most romantic cities in the world! 3) it is so centralised that sirens from the road occasionally woke us up. We would recommend this hotel although we felt the price was slightly too steep. All in all a good experience in the most wonderful city!!

Reviews.Title: “helpful receptionists and good location”
Reviews.Author: sleepyh
Reviews.Content: stayed at Le Petit for one night with fiance and dad & step mother, found it clean and modern decor and receptionist guys were very friendly and helpful. pros: - great location as other reviewers have said, not far from station but far enough! - receptionists gave us all the info we needed to help us get around Rome - nice modern decor and cool bathroom with slate tiles and glass sink - flat screen telly with sky cons: - the bed side lights didn't work - the bin men collecting rubbish outside at 5am! - we had a sofa in our room which was made up into a sofa bed - no idea why but it made the room a bit cramped! - orange juice at breakfast was horrid our room (208) was pretty large but I know some others are a lot smaller. The lift was out of service in the morning but that was due to renovation work elsewhere in the building so out of their control.

Reviews.Title: “great service at the right price in a good location”
Reviews.Author: dimmerlight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for Christmas 2005 and had a very pleasant stay. We found this hotel by reading reviews here, on [-------------]. We needed a place close to Termini(with easy access to the airport), centrally located to many of the sites/city and also close to metro station in a good neighborhood. We found out that walking to Termini is even faster than taking the metro for one stop, even with bags stuffed for overseas travel. We also choose to stay here because of a planned trip to Florence by train, so the fact that Termini is that close really helped. Also, the Metro Station Rapubblica is a minute away. Breakfast was by my standards gorgeous because they made incredible capuchino and cafe. I am not a big eater so a croissant un cafe made the day for me. The also have bread & jam, fruit for breakfast, cereal also I think, so you will be satisfied. Now, the room was also nice, with really big bathroom and pleasant interior. The stuff was courteous and helpful, in English. We were able to leave our bags there for the whole day on the last day so we can sightsee load free. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm always nervous when booking a hotel on line. But, we were pleasantly surprised with our room at the Le Petit in Rome. First of all, I just expect a European hotel to be small and, with a name like "Le Petit," well.... but I was shocked to find our room quite roomy. I have to say, we had one of the corner terrace rooms, so I can't speak for the other rooms. But, our room had plenty of walking space around the bed, a desk and two chairs, and an adequately large enough bathroom (small shower, but no smaller than any other place I've stayed at in Europe). The terrace was nice, with two large chairs and a table (wicker). We had the lowest terrace, which isn't the prettiest but appears to be the biggest. The room had high ceilings, was clean and well decorated (I'd describe it was a masculine Italian look) and the staff could not have been friendlier. There was no language problem; everyone had a heavy Italian accent, of course, but spoke & understood English. The location of the hotel was also a plus. You are literately around the corner from the Repubblica Metro station - a minute walk, TOPS. In addition, it is close enough to the main Termini station that you do NOT need to take the Metro or Taxi to get to Le Petit from there (you may not want to Metro with luggage). Yet, it's far enough from the Termini to avoid placing it in a somewhat "seedy" area of town. And, oh yes, one more thing that probably only ladies would care anything about - Of all the hotels I have ever stayed in, this one had the BEST hairdryer!!! Usually hotel hairdryers leave something to be desired, but this one was as good as mine at home! I would recommend the Le Petit and would DEFINITLY consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Rome where we stayed at Le Petit for 3 nights. The front desk staff were extra friendly and always eager to help. The hotel's building was under constructions, for which the front desk appologies for numerous times and no construction noises were ever heard in the room. We stayed at a newly renovated room on the 2nd (lobby) floor which offered a contemporary decor and an overall cozy room with a flat-panel TV. As other reviews have mentioned, the hotel is pretty much a walk from major sights (colloseum, Trevi, Spanish steps are all within a 10-15 min. walk) and if you don't want to walk, you can hop on the subway which is just around the corner. The hotel is also pretty close to the Termini station, so those who are arriving/departing by train are fortunate and do not require a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. It is in a perfect place to start everyday to see all the sights of Rome. The construction mentioned in many of the reviews is still on going, but it is of little concern since you are rarely at the hotel. The staff apologized daily for any inconvience. The room was great and had a nice balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: Esther71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband in Sept '05 and had a wonderful few days in Rome. The hotel rooms are small but the name does warn you of this and it really doesn't matter when you're out most of the time. The entrance is not grand, but as long as you're prepared for this, once you get into the hotal lobby it does improve dramatically. Our room was nicely decorated and the shower was a welcome relief after a day of pounding the streets. We requested one of the corner rooms with a terrace which was well worth the extra few euros - we do have a couple of photos of my husband dressed up as Ceasar using one of the hotel sheets, greeting his adoring citizens (me) in the street below. The hotel is well placed near Termini station and the metro. We always walked back to the hotel from wherever we were in the city, even late at night, and did not once feel unsafe. The hotel staff were friendly and very keen to tell you all about the main sights of their beautiful city. The breakfast was basic but there was more than enough. I spent a long time searching through reviews for hotels in our price range and was really pleased that we chose this one. Staying in Rome is such an experience, I hope you all have as much fun as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: RomewardBound
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lots of plusses and a few minuses. Plus Price, cleanliness, location, helpful staff Minuses Noisy, small rooms I was traveling with my teenage son and my mother (age 62). This is a nice hotel. It is close to the train/subway which makes it convenient when coming and going. Regardless of what you have heard, the area is nice. There are several 4 star hotels within a few buildings of Le Petit. There are several cafes/convenience stores right next door as well as a money exchange office across the street. We walked all over Rome from this location. Sometimes walking home at night, after we were tired, it seemed a little out of the way but honestly Rome is not that spread out. We always felt completely safe walking back to the hotel at night. The room we had (207) was fully updated and very nice but very small. We had 2 twin beds and a fold out ottoman for my son. The beds were lined up within a foot of each other making it quite cramped. However, we were only in the room to sleep so it made no difference. It would have been fine as a double. As a triple it was a little small. My son complained about the fold-out ottoman hurting his back as there was a bar right in the middle. He did seem to be in some pain from sleeping on this thing - and usually teenagers can sleep anywhere quite comfortably. Also, the shower was tiny. An obese person would find it almost impossible to enter into and use this shower. The stairs and hallways of the building are being renovated but it didn't affect the quality of our stay. On the minus side, the hotel seemed quite noisy. There was the usual 'all night long traffic' noise that you will find in any big city (think New York, Sydney, etc). Other than finding a hotel with sound-proof windows, I don't think you can avoid that problem. In addition, the walls within the hotel seemed a little 'thin.' We could hear our neighbors coming in late (1 -2am) at night and hear them talking quite clearly. We could hear very noisy groups of guests coming in late at night, being very loud. This happened every night we were there and was very disturbing to our sleep. I would probably stay at this hotel again but now that I'm more familiar with Rome I would definitely look into other options, too.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really cute hotel, it's convenient to the metro, atm across the street, convenience shop right next store and a pretty filling breakfast is included in a reasonable hotel rate. The room was small but newly redecorated and very clean .The staff is helpful and friendly and it's in a good area of town. I definately recommend it for a budget traveler!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Petit for 4 nights in Feb 2006. At first sight we wondered what we had let ourselves in for as the hotel lobby was on the second floor of a building which was undergoing renovations, bare plaster and scaffolding on the stairs! However when we entered the actual lobby it was small but immaculate. Very clean and modern with friendly staff. They advised us to use the lift as the stairs were being replastered-the lift is hopefully to be refurbished too as it kept telling us it was on the eighth or ninth floor when it was only a six floor building. Our rooms were lovely. Small but very clean, brand new bathroom and furnishings, air cond, tv, mini bar and phone. The only downside was the view from our balcony- the Best Western hotels fire escape next door and a brick wall but, we had no intention of sitting outside in Feb drinking cocktails so it was fine. Breakfast was a fresh coissant and bread, cereals, jam, pate, biscuits and coffee, tea, juice etc. Simple but fresh and served by friendly staff. Despite the renovations and view from our balcony we would definately stay here again. Hopefully next time the whole building will have been renovated and be up to the same standard as the interior of the hotel. Great location, 5-10 minutes walk from the termini station and just round the corner to the metro stop. Nice area which felt safe at night. Really easy to get everywhere and a bargain at £389.00 for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiTheBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two seperate nights on the lead up to Christmas. When we first arrived by taxi from the airport (something I would never do again as the station is so close) we were surprised and slightly concerned by the shabby and dirty state of the downstairs lift area. However, this is not unusual for Rome and indeed the actual hotel itself is modern, exceptionally clean and well organised. Reception was very friendly, helpful and informative. The rooms are modern and very clean. After checking out, the guy behind reception happily looked after our luggage while we carried out some last minute shopping and honestly, I have no complaints at all. I am fully intending to stay at this hotel again in the future, and fully recommend it to anyone looking for well priced accomodation in the centre of Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit for 3 nights in early Oct. The service from the front desk was fabulous. Very helpful pointing out nearby sights and allowing us use of their internet access. One of the best features of this hotel is the location! It is convenient to sights, shopping, grocery stores, transportation, etc. There were 4 of us with 2 rooms and one of the rooms had a balcony which was great for late aft.-early evening "happy hour" and discussing our day and making plans for the next! This is on a busy street so it is a little noisy at night-this would be the only negative and it is a SMALL negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights whilst sightseeing. Stay started well when the guy on reception took the time to highlight places of interest on a city map for us (without asking). Room was small (as expected) but so much to see in this city that we didn't spend much time there. Room was clean and quiet (but lack of mirrors). This hotel occupies 2 floors of a large building, which is 1min walk from the Metro station and 5 mins walk from Termini main line station. Breakfast was wonderful (typically continental).

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First floor of hotel is fine. Terrace room, 203, is very nice. Rest of hotel is undergoing update. Fourth floor rooms very small. Breakfast room very small, service was very friendly. Good location. Giani on the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer at Le Petit”
Reviews.Author: Lizlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent, well-located, clean, with very helpful staff who really seemed to want you to enjoy your stay in rome (even if they were from Transylvania!). Breakfast basic but good coffee. Room was small but nicely decorated and no smaller than others we had stayed in where size was not even mentioned, bathroom size was ok . Only problems - lights kept tripping and didn't always want to reset without help from reception and beds were very hard. Our room was on the Via Torino and was noisy at night but we never travel without earplugs anyway. Good value for position, very easy to get to places from metro at Republica 2 minutes walk away.Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not so hot”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Nitro
Reviews.Content: Most hotels in Rome are small, over-priced and not very impressive. Le Petit Hotel is no exception. The reception is on the second floor of a rather nondescript building. There was a lot of construction going on, so it probably seemed worse than it ultimately will be, but still. The room I got was on the fourth floor, and it was small and not terribly clean. They gave me one large bath towel and two tiny rags for hand-towels and liquid soap in dispensers in the shower and over the sink. Television was not satellite/cable, and not very good. The location, however, is excellent. I walked at 10pm from Termini to this hotel (5 minutes), and it is 60 seconds from Piazza de Repubblica (where there is a Metro station). I only had a few hours the next morning to sight-see, and the locaiton of this hotel allowed me to see plenty of the sites. I paid 95 Euros, and there was absolutley nothing in that area that was comparable, so I guess in terms of value for location, it's a good deal. Overall, if I visit Rome again, I will try to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location - within 15 minutes walk of Trevi, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon etc Right by Subway and 5 minutes walk to Termini station (the main train station in Rome) - so if you can get a CHEAPER transfer to the station do it as the hotel is just around the corner. Taxi transfer from station approx. 40 euros but try Terrorvision if you are travelling by Ryanair or Easyjet - they do have a website and offer cheap coach transfers to Termini Station. The hotel - very small rooms as one would expect in a major city, linen NOT changed daily, "kind of" cleaned daily, croissant and bread with jam and pate with coffee/tea/juice for breakfast. Some rooms on the same floor as the reception which can sometimes be noisy if the concierge has his mates around...very helpful staff on the other hand. If you can get a balcony then do as the views are lovely-very romantic. A/C not really cold enough but we did go in August!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite initial reservations as a lot of building work is being undertaken in the rest of the building, we made our way up to the 4th floor to find the recently renovated hotel. Reception was extremely friendly & helpful, and the rooms were clean with everything that you need. Breakfast was substantial.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rose206
Reviews.Content: Well located - close to the train station and many bus routes. Very friendly reception staff who were always willing to offer maps, tour ideas and free reference books from their library. The locked front door gave added security. The breakfast offered a pleasing variety.Rooms small but clean and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never been to Rome before, and after a lot of searching, decided on this Hotel. What a great find! The Hotel is situated in great location within walking distance of all the sights, and just round the corner from the Metro which we used, for instance, to go to the Vatican City (cost 1 Euro and a few minutes!). Hotel staff so pleasant and VERY helpful, gave us advice (usually over a lovely Breakfast), let us leave our Bags with them on our leaving day, ordering us a Taxi too. Cleanliness is very important to us, and we could not have asked for more in this respect. Bathroom immaculate along with the room which was cleaned every day with fresh towells, etc. We were lucky enough to spend our last (4th) night in the Superior room which had the most romantic Terrace, with table and chairs and view to Church Santa Maria Maggiore. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Petit”
Reviews.Author: MiriGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was lovely. The staff were helpful, especially Vitto!! Location was perfect, two minutes walk from the Metro. Breakfast was good, even got a decent cup of tea, which is very important for an Irish person :) Hope to get back to Rome again soon and will definately book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand " Le Petit "”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, one block from the marvelous Repubblica square, (in the corner there is the subway system ), few block from the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Colosseum and all the other. There wasn't a lobby nor concierge...it was moreso an entryway to an office building. It seemed more like there was a floor or two dedicated to "hoteling" and the rest of the floors were either for residents or offices like many hotel in Rome, but the building is wonderfull, white all white, with balconys, and terrace with columns. The hotel was very clean, with beds freshened daily, clean linens, hot showers. Very cozy room, colors painted on the wall, marvelous. The breakfast was great, the staff and management were very nice as well and knew all details like Romebynight, Highly recommended at everybody.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here unexpectedly when we extended our stay in Rome for a night and our original hotel was booked. From the outside and going up the stairs this hotel is not much, but once you're inside the lobby on the 4th floor you can't help but feel cozy. The staff was very freindly and the rooms exceptionally stylish and clean. We had the one with the terrace which was a very nice touch. It's teensy-weensy, but very homey.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, top situated in the heart of Rome, absolutely clean, service fast and very friendly! After our arrival at the airport we took the train to the station "stazione termini". Our hotel was only just about 500 meters away. The white building was very impressing. We entered and took the elevator up to the fourth floor. We did not expect such a nice entry with reception and breakfast-area. The very friendly staff showed us our room which was exactly this one you can see at the hotels homepage. The nice furnished room was very clean with beautiful colors, a comfortable doublebed and beautiful parquet floor. The very clean bathroom offers toilet, bidet, shower, hairdryer and so on. What we never expected was this undescribable beautiful balcony with its columnes. We enjoyed certain evenings with candlelight and a bottle of red wine outside over the roofs of the city. The traffic below was no problem because of the heat outside we had to close the windows and used the individually controllable aircondition. During our vacancy we also could see other rooms, everyone very nice. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast typically italian with cappuccino, cakes, juice ... The roomservice was excellent and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ruin your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend even my worst adversary to this hotel. I reserved this hotel in Rome for a week last month via internet. It was rated as 3 stars, but I found out that it is not worth one single star. Small was expected, but not the homeless-shelter smell, front desk person yelling constantly on the phone in Italian, yelling at hotel guests like myself who don't speak Italian, threatening to fine me for 1,000 Euro, and bad body odor. Also, the local tour they recommended was terrible. We took a day trip to Florence and had 20 minutes in the Museum, but they left you 2 hours in the shopping district. The receptionist in suit yelled at co-worker Jacque, the younger guy who was showing me places to go in Rome, I suspect, over who gets commission for the tour referral.

Reviews.Title: “price and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there in February 2002 and for the price i was paying this hotel met my expectations. Small rooms and then again it is called le petit! but large enough to suit our needs. The breakfast could offer more than things i can pick up at the local supermarket and that would be my only complaint. The rooms offer parque floors, the walls painted sponge style in soft shades of rose or orange, with blue bedding. The bathrooms offer the basic amenities with a stall shower and beige brown tiles. The staff were very helpful in offering tours and booking us a hotel in venice. They also stored our luggage for us. The bonus of this hotel is everything is within walking distance and they offer you a map to prove it. If i was ever visiting rome again this would be the place for me
